I often see videos where someone is putting together two vessels in orbit and there is a Distance to Target reticule and indicator painted over the other vessel. How do i turn this on? At this moment when I want to find out the distance to the target I have to go into the orbital map and mouse over the other vehicle.

Example:

http://gaming.stackexchange.com/questions/97228/how-do-i-rendezvous-and-dock-with-a-ship-in-orbit

Thanks in advance!

Hit f4.

Only works when you're something like 50M away.

I often see videos where someone is putting together two vessels in orbit and there is a Distance to Target reticule and indicator painted over the other vessel. How do i turn this on?

You target the vessel by clicking on it and 'set as target'.

I seem to recall that anything inside 30km pops up a distance counter as well when in view. At least does on the ground, it's how I know I've gone beyond 30km for the rover ribbon, lander no longer has the distance popup when I turn around (goes off right at 30km).
It does it in orbit too...you just have to have the target craft targeted. You can double click on the target in staging mode too once you're close enough.

Sometimes it's hard to find the other vessel when you're in orbit to see the distance display. It helps to point your vessel toward or away from the target using the Navball and then orient your camera to sight down it.
